definition: one breath/in one breath/at a stretch
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to heave a sigh of relief
erhua variant of 一口氣|一口气[yi1 kou3 qi4]
to gasp (in surprise, dismay, fright etc)
to heave a sigh of relief

sentences.english: I wolfed the whole two pounds of bread without stopping to take breath.
sentences.chinese: 我狼吞虎嚥地一口氣把整整兩磅麪包幹掉了。
深吸一口氣，現在呼出來，再來一遍。
他吸了一口氣，強自鎮定。

sentences.english: Take a deep breath and feel the beauty of language with heart. Look, you can do it!
sentences.chinese: 深呼一口氣，用心感受語言的美妙，瞧，你也能行。

sentences.english: She fidgeted in her chair as she took a deep, tremulous breath.
sentences.chinese: 她在椅子上坐立不安，輕顫着深吸了一口氣。

sentences.english: Only in the respiratory status of life between the breath does not come, things go much to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 況人生只在呼吸之間，一口氣不來，下去便很苦了。

sentences.english: Cindy:He let out a sigh of relief when he found out the baby was a brother.
sentences.chinese: 當他知道小北鼻是弟弟時，還鬆了一口氣呢。

sentences.english: He began to breathe at last, but his voice was unsteady.
sentences.chinese: 他終於開始吸上一口氣，但他的聲音聽來顫顫微微的。

sentences.english: I took a deep breath, gazed up at the sky and turned to Izumi.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了一口氣，凝視了一下天空，然後轉向泉。

sentences.english: He heaved a great breath and turned, remembering Carrie.
sentences.chinese: 他大大地鬆了一口氣，想起了嘉莉，便轉過身去。

sentences.english: He has no qualms about uttering these names in the same breath.
sentences.chinese: 對於自己一口氣說出這些名字，他並沒有感到不安。

sentences.english: A sigh of relief, but one moment, what about Sandro?
sentences.chinese: 這真讓人鬆了一口氣，但是，桑德羅呢？

sentences.english: I watched for four and half hours no-stop.
sentences.chinese: 我一口氣看了四個半小時。

sentences.english: Amelia gulped down her coffee and rushed out.
sentences.chinese: 米莉亞一口氣喝下咖啡便匆匆跑了出去。

sentences.english: He let out another sigh of relief.
She filled out another glass of wine and gulped it down.
sentences.chinese: 她又斟上一杯酒，一口氣喝乾。

definition: tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
